messages.body: $BB BlackBerry Secure Launches New Software Capabilities Aimed at Enterprise Users, IT administrators, and Developers - https://t.co/mNDlKSJgbp $MSFT $AAPL $GOOGL

links.title: BlackBerry Secure Adds New Software Capabilities Aimed at Enterprise Users, IT administrators, and Developers
links.description: In today's hyperconnected world the need for efficiency, compatibility, and security is more essential than ever. As part of BlackBerry's goal to empower the securely connected workforce we are releasing new software capabilities to bolster our BlackBerry Secure platform. BlackBerry enables workforce productivity with secure anytime, anywhere collaboration across any endpoint.

messages.body: $BB BlackBerry and Microsoft team up to introduce BlackBerry Enterprise Bridge https://t.co/hZ6XqzB11I $AAPL $MSFT $GOOGL

links.title: BlackBerry and Microsoft team up to introduce BlackBerry Enterprise Bridge
links.description: WATERLOO, Ontario and REDMOND, Wash., March 19, 2018 (GLOBE NEWSWIRE) -- BlackBerry Limited (NYSE:BB) (TSX:BB) and Microsoft Corp. (NASDAQ:MSFT) today announced a strategic partnership to offer enterprises a solution that integrates BlackBerry's expertise in mobility and security with Microsoft's unmatched cloud and productivity products.

messages.body: The US Vs. AT&T-Time Warner: Inside The M&A Trial Of The Decade https://benzinga.com/z/11379650 $T $TWX $DIS $FOXA $CMCSA $NFLX $FB $AAPL $GOOGL

links.title: US Vs. AT&T-Time Warner: Inside The M&A Trial Of The Decade (NYSE:T)(NYSE:TWX)
links.description: AT&T Inc. (NYSE: T) will face off against the U.S. Department of Justice Monday in a six- to eight-week trial determining the fate of its Time Warner Inc (NYSE: TWX) acquisition. Judge Richard Leon announced March 15 that opening arguments will begin Wednesday following two days of hearings.

links.title: BlackBerry and Microsoft team up to make work phones more secure
links.description: The team-up extends to Microsoft's Azure cloud platform. BlackBerry Dynamics and a handful of other services are now available through Azure for those outfits that mostly live in a Microsoft world. The two are betting that this alliance will be particularly helpful for banks, governments, health care providers and others that often count BlackBerry and Microsoft as customers.

links.title: Here Are the Biggest Losers Monday From Each Major Index
links.description: Markets were falling sharply Monday, March 19, as Facebook Inc. ( FB) led the tech sector lower. The Nasdaq had its worst day of trading in nearly 2 months, though the major markets were able to close off of session lows on a dismal day of trading.
